No one cares about the front line workers or patients. Upper management are clueless. They lie, backstab and staff split. High turnover. No policies. Very unprofessional building.

review_title: Best job I ever had experience marred by outsourcing and mishandling of transition by senior leadership
job_title: IT Service Desk Analyst in Lewiston, ME
pros: + Pay was modest for the area. + Worked with a diverse set of applications and technologies. + Rewarding to help clinical and non-clinical staff resolve their technical issues. + Department had a great team collaboration. +Got to work from home.
cons: - Change in company culture due to restructuring. organization disconnect between c-suite and the regional hospitals. Organization mission values only seem to be brought up / followed when convenient and otherwise forgotten. -Job outsourced to a 3rd party vendor under precarious circumstances, was given no option of transfer between organization leadership and the 3rd party contractor.

review_title: Not bad until they outsource your job lol
pros: A lot of vacation time. Many nice people who really care about the organization and patients.
cons: Smarmy talk about catholic values from leadership when it serves their purposes. Less than market pay.

pros: Good hour availability depending on your day or night shift preference. Small team that is comfortable working together.
I got to work with a TON of technology that nobody knew anything about.
cons: Consolidating 3 hospitals put each individual hospital in a worse position than they were in previous.

pros: You can get some experience to take to your next job. Coworkers are generally good. Lots of varying software and hardware to get hands on experience with.
cons: This organization treats its staff as numbers, not people. They take as much advantage as they can. No proper pay scales. Underachieving staff get the same pay and review bonus as staff operating at a higher level. No incentive or reason to grow or do better. Very high turnover rate due to this. Constant budget issues. The first things cut are training and employee benefits.

job_title: Patient Access Manager in New Delhi
pros: Small, non-factory, HR dept is good
Most of the people on the front lines are wonderful.  Wondeful mission-driven and non-profit.  They do a nice job integrating Catholic-values without shoving it down your throat.
cons: Lack of communication of big changes to middle-tier leaders.  Lots of changes at senior level with poor communication to the organization.  Struggling financially.  Little to no marketing and collaboration is non-exisistent.  No opportunities for education or growth. Won't even pay for cell phones for critical employees.  Example: Recently cut the community education program at one of their hospitals and didn't communicate it to anyone at the local level, shocking the community and employees.

pros: Fellow employees, a chance to make a positive change in health care for the community...
cons: Absolutely no loyalty shown to employees, even after 10-25 years of service. Numerous employees literally walked out without any reasonable notice after being told previously they would possible be shifted to a different role within the organization during a "restructuring." States a lot about Covenant's new culture.

review_title: Registered Nurse Short Ter Rehab and Long Term Care
pros: Health Benefits at Part Time Status. Recent salary increase for RN and LPN as well as CNA's.
cons: The Nurse to Patient Ratio is unmanageable. There is an extreme lack of professionalism and environment is uncomfortable making it very difficult to work together as a team. The management team lacks compassion and was often unavailable to address any concerns of their staff

review_title: Company had potential but not profitable
job_title: Director In Medical Group in Tewksbury, MA
pros: Some good people, had an good boss, fun place to work.
cons: Horrible communication, not profitable, disconnect between medical group leadership and alignment with system

review_title: Great company for part time work.
pros:
Great options for per diem employees.
Shift differentials between nights and weekends are great.
Continuous commitment to improving quality.
cons:
Company is not managed well.
Promotions occur due to tenure versus performance.
Sometimes low morale.

pros: Small company, benefits start immediately when hired, most everyone is welcoming and friendly, longevity in employees
cons: Poor morale secondary to new administration, unrealistic expectations for short term rehab floor
Inconsistent management, poor raises, terrible computer system
